text: So yeah, definitely not a 5* hotel but once you process that it‚Äôs alright!  Wouldn‚Äôt stay again as I think there are better hotels in the Algarve but we struggled to find availability when we were there.  The location is what makes it, the view, there is a fantastic walking trail right from the hotel & Carvoeiro has a lovely feel to it!  The staff were all lovely with us despite reading some reviews which stated otherwise.  The breakfast staff were the only ones who werent warm & friendly like the others.Didn‚Äôt eat at the restaurant but breakdown was alright and the pool food was ok too.  The drinks were good though!

Wonderful views, great staff, comfortable rooms, delicious food, loads of room for relaxing by the pool. What more can you ask for! We loved our stay and looking forward to returning to Quinta Mirabela and Madeira

an honest review..::pools- lovely and clean, water slides great fun but life guards not always keeping an eye out (for example there were some kids going down in fours on quite steep slides). considering the amount of guest there are simply not enough parasols provided by the hotel - this then results in people reserving beds from 7am onwards - the hotel could sort this with more parasolsfood- was very good - didn't understand previous reviews saying not hot enough- all the food we had was great as were the drinks.rooms- the balcony situation was not safe really. Heater system on balcony that  a child could climb up on possibly which considering this is a high rise hotel isn't good.the rooms also lacked any decoration which is something that could be improved on. Toiletries were also non branded and not what you would expect of a five star . bedding and bed were also not in line with five star - quite cheap feel to linen and mattresspool towels- never experienced this in a five star before but you can only change your towels between 9am and 12pm . Our towels were moved and when i asked for replacements I got accused by someone on reception of leaving towels on sunbeds too long to reserve them - despite me saying that was absolutely not the case I was spoken to quite rudely by this member of staff who eventually agreed to replace the towels after giving me quite an unnecessary lecture.sky bar - lovely and we really enjoyed this - beautiful views and like the rest of the hotel very cleanlocation- not the best really - one very good restaurant by the hotel called martinique which was amazingoverall not a five star so if you go expecting that you will be disappointed

We had a great stay and really enjoyed our time in the hotel.The pool entertainment during the day was great for kids but the nighttime shows could be better.Also would recommend some live music inside the hotel bar as this felt like we were just sitting in reception having a drink, there was no atmosphere.Only a short walk to the new town if you wanted a bit of a chance of scenery.Overall the staff were lovely and very accommodating and the food was good too. Would defo recommend

My wife and I spent a week at Belmar in February 2022. We had a spacious apartment with a lovely view of the beach (D2F). The resort is comfortable and clean, if a little sterile. But two things stand out.First the standard of housekeeping and maintenance is very high.Second the reception staff are exceptionally friendly and helpful. When we got back home I realised that I had foolishly left my car keys in the safety deposit box. I telephoned reception, who immediately found the keys. I sent my card details to cover the cost and Diana went to the post office and organised the return of my keys. I had them back within a week.I feel this was quite remarkable service and done with genuine friendliness,

Absolutely best holiday we‚Äôve been on, it was perfect for 2 afults and a 4 year old aswell as my mother and brother. We have everything we could possibly need, the weather was beautiful. It was just amazing from start to finish, thankyou to everyone who made it a holiday to remember!

We arrived here quite late at night, but pleasantly surprised at how friendly and knowledgable the man on the reception was who checked us in. They made us food to take to our room as it was really late even though we had allready declined.The rooms are nice and clean but don‚Äôt look out to much.The halls, as mentioned in previous reviews are disgusting.We as a family werent fussed with the food. We ate breakfast, sometime didn‚Äôt bother with lunch and most nights ate out for dinner.My opinion of the food is the presentation looks herrendous like slops, most food is bland or tasteless, the meal choices are very repetitive.I honestly can‚Äôt see how any one enjoys it.Pool area is great but very slippy.Plenty for kids and adults to do through the day and on an evening the entertainment is decent enough for a bit.The Jet2 rep is a bit like marmite. She does her job but not very forthcoming, we had the zoo marine included in our stay. (Zoo marine opens at 10 and shuts at 5pm) however weren't picked up till 10 and had to be back on the bus at 4pm so lost out on two hours there so everything there seemed like an absolute rush. They email you a letter but don‚Äôt think to tell you to get it printed before hand. Also note that we arrived the Thursday night and Friday we just wanted to enjoy the day the Saturday we wanted to book zoo marine to be told it was open Wednesday to Saturday so nearly didn‚Äôt get there as we were only there for a week anyway but this wasn‚Äôt relayed to us at any point until it was nearly to late.We as a family had a good time there as it is what you make it. We met some great people.I would just think if you are a bit funny with food or have certain tastes I would potentially take extra spending money as the strip is a 10 minute walk to find good food and bars.

If you are travelling with the family this hotel has everything you need to keep the children entertained. The main pools were very busy with things for the children and the slides were great fun. The quiet pool was a welcome break from the busy areas. Food was excellent and everywhere was very clean. We had a junior suite and a standard room with pool view both of which were of a good size. Not very close to the beach however there was a free shuttle bus which ran regularly. A great family week away.

You were received by nice and friendly staff. We were escorted to our room and he told us at the same time about the facilities and about the hotel. Super welcome. We had ordered a suite with sea views. It was fantastic to open the balcony door and hear the showering sea. The rooms were really nice and large.

This is the fourth hotel we came to as part of two weeks holiday in Madeira. I have to say I had bigger expectations. The good things: the location and views are amazing, and the staff is nice. However, the rooms are not in the best condition (at list not ours). The bathroom doesn't look very clean and some furniture is old and broken. The breakfast is poorly organised under the covid restrictions (we have been into three other hotels and it worked really well). It took us 20 minutes just to get coffee and juice, and we could see many tables waiting for food. The food is ok but not great.

hotel_name: Valverde Lisboa Hotel & Garden - Relais & Ch√¢teaux
text: Fantastic hotel! Super comfortable accommodation, very well decorated, quality sheets and pillows. Coffee and coffee maker available in the room. Wonderful shower!! Pay special attention to bathroom amenities, such as body lotion, soap, shampoo and conditioner of extreme quality (I even bought it and brought it to Brazil) because it is so wonderful! The highlight was the breakfast, simply fantastic, very complete! The staff is also amazing, always friendly, friendly and very helpful. We have nothing but praise for this hotel! We will recommend it to friends who are in Lisbon.

The hotel was so lovely and clean, really nicely decorated and a perfect atmosphere. We stayed for three nights and arrived to find custard tarts and small bottles of port in our rooms as a welcome. Really lovely. We ate in the hotel which was absolutely delicious. We did have a noisy room on the road side of the first floor -  I am a very light  sleeper and so I didn't sleep so well. We asked reception the next day if there was any other rooms available and they were very helpful and friendly. Luckily they did have a room on the third floor square side with fantastic views of the castle, and much quieter. Thank you so much as it really made all the difference. I would highly recommend staying at this hotel. Breakfast was also superb!!

hotel_name: Valverde Lisboa Hotel & Garden - Relais & Ch√¢teaux
text: If you‚Äôre coming to Lisbon, you absolutely must stay at the Valverde Hotel. Ideal location aside, the hotel is incredibly beautiful, the service was fantastic, the rooms are so comfortable, the pool and other amenities are great and it is such a lovely place to stay - whether you‚Äôre traveling alone, with friends, with a significant other or with family. I will definitely be staying here again on my next trip!

Clean, Well kept, Amazingly helpful & friendly staff,...!  Full of good information for Lisbon!    We(a group of 17 family members!) had to leave early the next morning- they    fixed us breakfast 1 hour before the kitchen opened...!!!!  Will be back, for sure!

hotel_name: Dona Filipa Hotel Vale Do Lobo
text: This was our 5th visit and as always we received a very friendly welcome. The service was first class - the staff are unfailingly polite and courteous. The refurbishment of the rooms is very impressive and has been done in a stylish and sympathetic way with the result that the hotel has lost none of its charm or atmosphere. The San Lorenzo Golf course remains our favourite course on the Algarve. Looking forward already to February 2016! GJB
Stay at a great hotel with really caring staff and especially Patrick, who is really super nice, friendly, whether at the pool or at the bar, he is always attentive!!!Patrick very very good

Stay  four nights at the Rossio Patio hostel and had a fantastic time. This hostel brings hosteling to a whole new level.. it is a luxury hostel but with hostel hospitality and prices! The open concept lounge and kithcen are just amazing with tonnes of plants and natural sunlight. This is a new hostel so everything is brand new.The owners (Dangolia and Joao) are superbe people who go out of their way. The staff  are super friendly and interested in helping you out with the little details. For example, I came in from the rain and they offered me a hair blower and when we needed to dry our clothing, brought us a rack to hang out clothes to dry. It is just amazing and the location is just perfect!!

We booked last minute and what a find! The best check in we have every had world wide! (Ana da Silva ) I am sure once others find out about this hotel which was opened in February this year that we won't find it easy to book anymore ‚òπÔ∏è it's placed a good five mins walk from down town but trust me that's a positive, you can travel so many ways in Lisbon the metro (underground) is a few meters away from hotel which I must say is the best way to get to this hotel from the airport it's so super easy! And very cheap! This hotel is small but perfect in every way, you have everything you need and it's so modern and cool with people who connect with you not as you would in other hotels, to explain this both my wife and Ana on reception where in tears as we left today! I must also mention a special lady in the restaurant she is called marianer, this girl connects genuinely with you giving not only a fantastic service but fun and intelligent conversation.To sum up this elegant super modern super friendly hotel would be my only choice when we return period!

What a lovely hotel.This hotel is half way between the old town and New town but has a lovely quiet location .The apartments are beautiful and staff were brilliant especially Carlos and Rahan on reception. The rooms are cleaned regularly and the pool area is nice .Overall we had a great time .If I had a slight problem it would be that everything is geared for French tourists and most entertainment is in french .

My husband and I spent 4 days at the Marriot in October of 2001. We were on our 25th wedding anniversary. The people were very friendly and helpful. We would stay at this hotel if we come to Lisbon again.

The room with the small terrace was very comfortable. I liked the boat trip to the Atlantic Ocean, but also the pool at the hotel. The location was great , and because we were on a bike trip, and therefore could take the bikes to the town of Tavira, and back to the hotel very easily. I would certainly come again, if I am going to Tavira.

We enjoyed this hotel, nice facility (but they need to enable ALL 4 elevator banks) with a great Club room.  A little removed from downtown and the waterfront but easily and quickly accessible via train.  Nice place.

2021/2022 - 2 x 60th birthdays with friends did not transpire as Covid prevented our planned trip. A year later 2022/2023 we finally arrived & Lisbon Portobay did not disappoint on anything. Thank you to you all for making our 5 ‚≠êÔ∏è experience a memorable stay in a most wonderful city.

Marriott/SPG Gold with roughly 60 hotel nights annually...This is a decent Marriott, but I wasn't blown away.Pros- Relatively modern with solid upkeep.- Comfortable bed.- Good breakfast, with an omelette station and very efficient waitstaff.- Executive lounge with complimentary beer/wine and hors d'ouvres in the evening.- Quiet part of town.Cons- Off the beaten path, with no restaurants/cafes nearby (though taxis are cheap).- Food prices seemed very high.- A good 20-minute (uphill) walk from the nearest Metro stop, with bumpy (and slippery when wet) tile path all the way up - it's sure to do a number on the wheels of your roller bag and I'd recommend a taxi to get here.- Room was pretty standard. Doubt I received an upgrade (and I didn't note an Executive/Marriott Preferred floor (lounge is off the lobby).- Painfully slow Internet. It claimed I was getting 'Enhanced Internet' but if this was enhanced, I'd hate to see the Normal! Reminded me of a 128kb copper wire connection from 15-20 years ago!- Carpet in my room needed a thorough cleaning!- A room service tray sat out in the hall near my room for 6+ hours without being collected.Be forewarned...the property seems to be on the tour bus circuit, so you can end up with dozens of people swarming in/out at odd hours, slamming doors, propping doors open and visiting 'neighbors,' etc. I even heard a dog barking incessantly one evening.

hotel_name: Reid's Palace, A Belmond Hotel, Madeira
text: The hotel is run very professionally. The staff are engaging, friendly and polite with the service and restaurants being excellent. Beautiful location with easy access into the Old Town. Looking forward to returning to Reeds Palace in the future.

About 10 minute cab from airport. To downtown is about 15-20 minutes by cab. Staff is friendly. Hotel has been renovated and rooms are comfortable. The appetizers is the bar are reasonably priced and good.

Given that Casa Mitchell is just few minutes walk from the hectic and noisy old town square, it is incredibly quiet and peaceful once you get to your apartment. All the apartments are fully equipped with all the necessary appliances and cooking utensils. There is a small supermarket next door and a bigger one just 5 minutes walk along Rua Sir Richard Cliff (yes a street named after him). The apartment are spacious with a lounge, dining area  / double and single bedrooms, bathroom and balcony.On the ground floor is the swimming pool which also opened to guests staying at Vila Branca.The beach and the old town square are also within 5 minutes walk.All in all Casa Mitchell is a very nice clean, comfortable and peaceful place to unwind after a hectic night out in town.

Excellent hotel with excellent service. The bed is big and soft. Bathroom is cleaned and all the toiletries are provided. The air conditioning is working and cool enough for the night. The breakfast is superb with lots of choices as well.  They do provide postcard mailing service. Definitely will return if visiting Lisbon in future.

Booked  here for three nights initially but on realising how special this hotel and surrounding area is we quickly extended our stay for another night! The whole experience was perfect from the start, after arriving late at night we received a very friendly and informative welcome with a personal guided tour of the hotel from Jorge who works in reception who also took our luggage from the car to the rooms. Everything about this hotel oozes quality but without being too pretentious, the rooms (sea view) were on the third floor below the reception level but had the most fantastic view of the bay and sea. The breakfast quality and choice was the best I have ever experienced in any similar sized hotel, the staff are efficient and friendly stopping to take photos and answer any questions, the omelete chef at breakfast is very good as well as being entertaining!  The rooms have a Nespresso machine provided to make coffee and tea and the bar staff helped out with extra milk. The hotel is very cleverly built into the cliff which makes it blend into the landscape, the small and very pleasant town of Carvoeiro with a lovely beach is only 15 min walk away and there is another beach a similar distance (Centeanes) in the other direction which has a decent restaurant where you can watch the sunset.The most memorable part of this stay though has to be the breathtaking location and view of the bay which draws you in every time you walk by the reception area. Overall a perfect place for a relaxing stay in this beautiful part of the world. We will be back.

Amazing hostel! I was for 4 nights in a 8 female room. We had our own bathroom. But the hostel had other showers and toilets outside our room too if our personal bathroom was busy. I always had my privacy. The breakfast buffet was totally enough and good. The people working there were super kind helpful. And I also got a room and hostel tour on my first day I arrived.The hostel is near by alfama . You have great sights and viewpoints near by. The transport system is amazing everything near by walk ,tram  or bus both. I highly recommend this hostel! Best hostel experience ever. Plus we had a chandelier in our room. Super fancy!!

Really enjoyed our stay at Torel Palace Porto. Room was comfortable, loved our balcony  and the staff was awesome. We walked everywhere from the hotel. Especially enjoyed the cafe for late day tea/coffee and wonderful pastries. The decor of the hotel is top notch, so beautiful.

If your looking for a nice relaxing holiday this is the place,the staff are so lovely and nothing is a problem, lovely food,beautiful big rooms,they even have there own coach and mini buses for different things you can put your name down for, just a perfect time had by us both cannt wait to go back xxxx

hotel_name: Reid's Palace, A Belmond Hotel, Madeira
text: We popped over for just 2 nights to celebrate my 60th Birthday. We worked it out that it was just 7 hours from our front door to the Tea Terrace, or about he same time it takes us to get to Cornwall!As ever very attentive staff with a warm welcome back, and welcome bubbly our bedroom.Had the same room as last year and felt like we had never left.The micro climate played in our favour so whilst Monte was swaddled in cloud we could still comfortably sunbathe by the Pool.The Villa Cipriani was as excellent as ever and it says something positive about Reids when your waiter has been there for 47 years!My wife thought that the gardens were at the best she has seen them in over 30 years.We are already trying to find an excuse to book again for next year

Great location and views of the ocean. Right on the water. Staff was attentive and made excellent suggestions for travel stops. We were going to go to Cadiz, in Spain, but the bellman recommended that we go visit Rhonda instead. This was an excellent choice as it was a beautiful city.

Very good service! The roof top is very beautiful and the conditions of the rooms and the hotel are excellent. The breakfast was wonderful and there was no noise in the rooms. Very close to the center and you can easily walk to the sites. I recommend !
While I was staying here a pair of shoes were removed from my room.After quering staff they refused to offer any responsibility for the loss.

This hotel is in an excellent position right on the beach. The pool is enormous but the best thing is there are enough sun beds round the pool and free towels. The pool is very clean as is the area around it. Staff are really pleasant, but they don't do \rush\"All rooms have a sea view
month: are spacious with air conditioning. The bathroom was huge !Breakfast buffet was fantastic with so much choice and a beautiful setting looking over the ocean.  Direct access to the beach and lovely little beach bar. Only a 10 minute walk along the ocean front to the marina
year: with millionaire boats and fast cars.. Bit of a boys and toys area. Restaurants all very reasonably priced and you do not feel you are being ripped off when eating on the marina front.  Highly recommended and we will definitely go back."

text: I had such a wonderful experience at this hotel. There was a nice, local cherry brandy (I believe it was brandy?) upon checking in. They disclaimed that my room might feel small, but for a solo traveler, it was the right size. The desk by the window, the rainfall + detachable shower heads. It was clean and the bed was very comfortable. The public space for breakfast was beautiful and a big breakfast itself was delicious. I especially enjoyed the location and decor of books/writings everywhere.A huge plus was their staff. While check-out was at 11 AM, my flight was significantly delayed (late PM) and I worried about where to store my luggage for so long. Without hesitation, they held my luggage for as long as I needed and invited me to spend time in the public spaces to feel comfortable.I'd stay here again and cannot sing their praises enough.

Excellent hotel.  Staff were really friendly and could not do enough to make your stay perfect.  The beds were comfortable and the food at the snack bar was delicious.  Excellent location.  Will definitely go back.

Overall good, staff helpful, good location.No rule about leaving/booking your lounger around the pool area,most loungers had towels on them before breakfast time( No German or Dutch holiday makers around) British & Irish only,the hotel don't seem to be bothered.Food got better as the week went on, fresh orange juice on the last day of our stayCoffee maker? no coffee,no cups,no kettle.in the room.

Fantastic beach side Boutique Hotel.. Sabine is fantastic ‚Ä¶The laid back style with fresh delicious food. A gem and a credit to all concerned.We have been many times and will be back again as soon as possible.Families of just couples, the best.

Absolutely fab place. Great room, big pool, never short of sunbeds, food available from bar.  Just an amazing place. We loved it we were four females it was safe clean. Staff were so helpful and on hand 24/7. Close by to the shops, beach and the strip. Taxi ride to old town only √Ç¬£7 euros  fab place so many bars restaurants and entertainment. Thanks natura for a lovely holiday √∞≈∏ÀúÀú

We did not have a booking and found o O Castelo Guess House on the lonely planet book - what a lucky day. Only one room available and the one with a beach view!!!!Upon arrival, the staff efficiently check us in and helped us with our big and heavy luggages to go down the stairs. The room was spotless!!! There was a self-contained kitchen, large bathroom and the bedroom was big enough but the best was outside - the view from the balcony was a portrait. The blue ocean, the cliffs and the village... one could sit there for hours enjoying the view while drinking a good portuguese wine or beer.Later on the day, we had the opportunity to meet the owner - such a gentleman.It was such a shame we were there for one night only.Needless to say that I highly recommend O Castelo and cannot wait to go back there.

Booked this hotel as they pride themselves on their website as an oasis of tranquility and ideal for families.  If you are a family then don√¢‚Ç¨‚Ñ¢t book this hotel for your stay as it is not a hotel that caters for families.During our week the hotel was just full of groups of lads causing disruption around the pool during the day. Every morning between the hours of 2-5am we would be woken by shouting, aggressive swearing and just football hooligan type behaviour√¢‚Ç¨¬¶√¢‚Ç¨¬¶.total disregard to other guests in the hotel.On a positive note the staff are great and Pierre cannot do enough for you and appreciated our concerns during our stay.If you√¢‚Ç¨‚Ñ¢re a group of lads looking to book a hotel for your Albufeira holiday then it√¢‚Ç¨‚Ñ¢s ideal for you but if you√¢‚Ç¨‚Ñ¢re a family then stay well clear as there are plenty of better hotels in the area.

Stayed at the Crowne Plaza Vilamoura for a very restful week of sunbathing, swimming and relaxing and it suited these purposes perfectly. The kids loved the pool, lounge, gym and spa and it had direct beach access which was fantastic. The room was rather on the small side but we were never in it except to sleep. You have to be down by the pool before 8am to reserve a lounger, before they are nabbed by guests, but I'm usually up before 7am so this wasn't a problem. My son cut his foot 3 times in the pool quite badly and was told by staff he could not swim for two of the days we were there as the cuts were so deep, which was unfortunate for him and ruined his fun a bit. I hope the hotel take responsibility for this health and safety problem and check the ruling and safety in the pool regularly. The buffet breakfast and dinner were fabulous, great choice of food and beautifully presented. The staff were amazing and really aimed to please. The Marina is 10 minutes away with restaurants, bars and boutiques and the golf is a 10 minute drive. A very safe family friendly environment. Would go back for a restful week or two as we had a great time.

Arrived here in the morning but couldn't check into our room until 3pm, however there is a room we could leave our luggage and we were able to use the pool whilst we waited!The apartments are great, very spacious and cleaned everyday, with a nice big balcony too, no complaints there!The pool area is great, we loved the space and how quiet it was even at peak time in August! Never had to go down early to do the towels on the sunbed routine, some days we didn't go to the pool until about 10.30am and there were still sun beds free, amazing!It is a good location, about 10-15 walk to the strip and the beach, and about a 40 mins walk to the old town. We found the best beach to be the Praia Balaia which is a left turn from the roundabout by the Chinese, the sea is warmer and shallower and much better for kids!We had no problems at all with the couple of hen and stag parties that were there, we didn't see any sign of behaviour others have mentioned and would recommend this accommodation to everyone!

Fantastic service and wonderful location on the water. I would highly recommend this hotel if one wants a peaceful stay in Lisbon. 10mins from the city centre but in the trendy neighborhood of Belem. I have been twice and would dog back.

Of 5 hotels we stayed at in Portugal, including some other top notch properties, this was our favorite. So lovely and peaceful. Wonderful staff and large comfortable room. Great food. We ate in both the hotel bar and the restaurant. Delicious breakfasts and dinners (farm to table). Highly recommend it.

Stayed at Eurostar for two nights, wish it was more!  Great location, beautiful hotel, excellent breakfast buffet.  Room was large and very comfortable, river view.  Huge shower! Roof top terrace very pleasant.  Staff was most helpful and friendly.  Great location, you can walk to almost anywhere.  I loved it!  I would stay again in a heart beat!

The Ocean Gardens hotel is a beautiful hotel in Funchal. All rooms overlook the Atlantic Ocean and the views are stunning. The cleanliness of the rooms and hotel in general cannot be faulted. The swimming pool and surrounding areas are also very well kept. Just one complaint (and it's a personal one really): the rooms do not have tea and coffee making facilities and the beds are rock hard. Also, you have to rely on the free hotel bus or public transport busses to take you into the city, the roads are quite windy to walk along them safely. However, the hotel was ideal for what we wanted which was to rest.

After 21 years without visiting Elvas this was really  a good choice to stay, big room, the buffet food was good specially the main course nice breakfast. The different areas of the hotel are spacious, such as the bar the smoking room, a bath at the swimming pool was good and made the difference from the heat of Alentejo.

The hotel was very clean with excellent spa facilities such as indoor pool and Jacuzzi (free of charge at this point).  Breakfast had a great deal of choice cereals, juices cooked, continental, fresh eggs and pancakes, differing breads and lots of fruit. Tavira is a great place unless you want benidormesque trad beer chips and discos which we do not :).  It is quite charming with a nice central square, gardens and pretty bridges. Lots of winding streets over the bridges hide numerous little restaurants & cafes.  Camera obscura, castle and churches a good to visit.  A must is either local beach via ferry under 2 euros and less than 8 mins or water taxi to cabanas beach 30 each way for boat (holds 10).

The hotel has a nice view overlooking the river. The problem is that it doesn‚Äôt have a drive way so you need to park on the sidewalk to get your luggage out. If you are bringing a car reserve a parking spot ahead of time because they have very limited parking. Only 1 or 2 at the front desk know how to answer your questions, the rest are a bit under informed. The room had a missing shower door in the bathroom. The a/c didn‚Äôt really cool down the room. It is a bit of a walk to the attractions.

Wonderful place, restful and loads of places to see in the hotel complex .Special mention to Chef Sandip who was Amazing making me special food as I have a dietary restriction and also the whole of the Hospitality team .The rooms we had were lovely and clean, just a bit of a smell from the drains, when the tide turns we were told! Two fabulous pools and piano bar.All in all a great time and really enjoyed it there.

hotel_name: Porto Pal√É¬°cio Hotel by The Editory
text: Luxurious hotel with bath robe trimmings far out of centre with a bleak entrance. Large comfortable room. But then... internet charges E10/day, bottle of water E5, dull breakfast. No coffee for those leaving before breakfast serving starts.

This five stars olympic hotel, that is, that surprises by its greatness and importance, is locate in Belem on the north margin of the river Tagus. The rooms have a beautiful view to the river and have asian names. Our was called Kyoto. The room was large but the atmosphere was a bit cold. The decoration is modern and simple. The bathroom very suitable. The staff is very well educated and helpful. They discovered I was having my birthday and at breakfast they offered me a cake with a lighted candle and two glass of champagne. It was really nice! We also could check out one hour later for free. There is a Spa with an indoor pool. Breakfast is excellent. An extremely good bet for accomodation in Lisbon. Prices have a very good value for money.
Had a great meal in the tapas restaurant, the guys gurpreet & Jatinder were excellentThe wine was lovely also √∞≈∏Àú‚Äö√∞≈∏Àú‚Äö√∞≈∏Àú‚Äö√∞≈∏Àú‚Äö√∞≈∏Àú‚Äö

The hotel was well situated, very clean, and comfortable. But most importantly, the staff was outstanding. My husband had a medical emergency that required an ambulance trip to the emergency room. Alone in a foreign country, this was a scary experience. The staff were supportive and concerned. I especially want to commend the manager, Ali Farhat. He went way beyond expectations in helping us extend our stay and in feeling that we had someone to turn to when we needed help.
I went today with my daughter, Tidjane was a very helpful server , he gave good service and good food recommendation, he was very friendly and attentive

I stayed here as a single traveler for 10 nights on my first visit to Portugal and thoroughly enjoyed my stay. The room was clean and quiet. The bathroom was very modern and convenient. The staff is helpful and friendly. There is a great grocery store a short distance away and a convenient red line metro station directly in front of the hotel. Breakfast was generous and tasty. I would stay here again!

The best about this hotel is the location and views.Bedrooms are modern and well equiped, and everything is perfectly clean.The staff are friendly and helpful.Breakfast can be a bit confusing during peak times, but the quality of the food is good.A nice place to stay if you're going to an even at Altice Arena or FIL.

I've stayed at a fair number of hostels across Europe now and this hostel in Lisbon is one of the best on my travels.  It would be better than many of the budget hotels there across multiple criteria.The location is brilliant: it's immensely convenient for backpackers.  It is close to one of the main metro stations (Baixa/Chiado) and less than a 10-minute walk to Rossio Square and Pra√É¬ßa da Figueira, which have important transport links for day trips such as Belem.  The city is very walkable from the hostel as it is so centrally placed.The rooms are modern and comfortable.  The beds offer a surprising amount of privacy because they are quite 'deep' and have good curtains across the side of the bunk.  I had a great quality of sleep and the curtains can hide the stumbles and light shone by late-night visitors in the dorm.  Communal areas and shared bathrooms were clean.  There is nice cosy furniture and great atmosphere in the main communal area on the ground floor!I definitely recommend the hostel's cheap four-course dinner; I've not seen hostels offer anything like it in other European cities.  The sangria top-ups with the dinner were great.  The free breakfast is also good.The staff here are so welcoming and friendly!  I had great banter at the bar.  I was organising this trip in a group and we had a payment issue for the group reservation but they were nice enough to let us pay on arrival.  I recommend the hostel's free walking tour, though I did not go on the pub crawl as our group had its own adventures in Bairro Alto.I cannot really fault this hostel.  The only niggle was that a significant number of people across the hostel did not know their allocated beds (I noticed a funny passive-aggressive handwritten note at the bar on this issue!).

The Clarion Suites hotel is equidistant from Rato and Marques de Pombal, forty minutes from the airport and about fifteen minutes from the centre of Lisbon by metro.  Our suite consisted of a large bedroom with plenty of wardrobe space, a well-equipped bathroom and a living room with a kitchenette.  Twice a much space as in most hotel rooms and very luxurious.  The beds were extremely comfortable and there is a television in each room.  On the downside you will be charged for everything in the fridge, including the bottled water, although tea bags and coffee sachets are free.  Also beware of the thin bedding and rescue the blanket from the wardrobe if you are there in winter.  The staff are friendly and helpful, they give you a map and look after your bags after checkout.

We stayed for 7 nights in a sea view balcony room. The staff were welcoming and friendly and all speak excellent english. They responded immediately to any requests we had and were always on hand to answer questions or chat or make us a cocktail in the afternoon. The room was minimal, spotlessly clean with lovely crisp linen and a large comfortable double bed. There's a fridge but no tea or coffee making facilities in the room but you can easily nip downstairs for tea or coffee and bring it back up to drink on the balcony. The bathroom was compact but perfectly adequate and the shower powerful with lots of hot water. There is aircon which it is advisable to use at night - it's lovely to sleep with the doors to the balcony open, listening to the sea, but you'll provide a feast for the mosquitoes and regret it the next day. Breakfast is served buffet style with fruit, bread, cheese, cold meats and delicious traditional cakes and sweets ...custard tarts...mmm.. ..fruit juice and as much coffee as you want. There is a terrace on which to sit and watch the sun climb in the azure sky - there's no better way to start the day.The Mareta View has a garden with sun beds and palm trees and a small jaccuzi. Set above the beach there is always a cool breeze and enough shade to sit and read a book or snooze.The area around the Mareta View is the quiet end of Sagres - although there doesn't seem to be a noisy end really - there are numerous cafes and restaurants - many within walking distance or others a short drive. We ate in a different great place every evening. Especially recommended are Tonel Beach Cafe - Michelle is half English and half Portugese - she serves delicious homemade burgers and toasties all amazingly cooked up in what amounts to a shack on the small secluded beach just  along from the fort where bikers and surfers hang out. They close at 7pm so Michelle recommended the restaurant on Zavial beach for our evening meal and she was right - we had a fantastic last evening meal on a large terrace overlooking a deserted pristine sandy beach as the sun went down.Sagres is a perfect get away from it all destination if you want peace and quiet and you like your sun with a cooling breeze. The sea is too cold to swim in without a wetsuit unless you're made of sterner stuff than us, but the trade off is the magnificence of the waves coming in off the Atlantic, which personally I could sit and watch all day.There is a small supermarket within walking distance and the larger Intermarche on the road coming into Sagres from Faro where you can get everything from food to toiletries to nice wines and spirits and the daily paper. With a car you can explore up the coast through the Parque Natural - there are beautiful beaches like the one at Borderia - completely worth the hike across the small river from the car park. The sandy beach is huge - no chance of overcrowding here. Make sure you call in at the Micro Bar in Carrapateira for a stunning burger with milkshake or delicious looking things on toast - but leave room for one of the fabby puddings in the chiller cabinet.If you're looking for night life or shopping or huge amounts of culture, this really isn't the place for you. If you want to relax, eat well, do a spot of people watching and let it all hang out, head for Mareta View - we loved it.

We enjoyed our stay immensely.  The rooms were very clean and comfortable and suitable for such an old town.The hotel offers an evening meal but we decided upon a local restaurant. Breakfast was pleasant, but limited.We look forward to our return.

hotel_name: ibis Styles Lisboa Centro Liberdade NE
text: I liked my 2-night stay at the hotel a lot, which was a surprise for me, to be honest, because my expectations for the ibis brand were pretty low, knowing that hotels of this brand are usually very basic. First of all, the hotel has a great location in a nice and pretty quiet area of Lisbon, not far from the historic center. The walk to the center is around 20 minutes. Plus, this location is perfect if you want easy access to the airport, as you can avoid a lot of traffic without entering the typical narrow Lisbon Old City streets.The hotel is generally remodeled. It was spotlessly clean every day of my stay. A day before my check-in, I requested an early room preparation, and finally I was allowed to check in an hour early. All the front desk staff were friendly and nice to me. I have to mention the small elevator, which could barely fit me and my 2 pieces of luggage, and was a bit slow.I got a nice room with 1 double bed. I liked its basic but cute design. The room was an average medium size, but I felt comfortable there. All the furniture was in very good condition. The bed was comfortable. There was a small refrigerator, which was a plus. Even though my room was on the second floor, it was well soundproofed. I heard almost no noise from the street or the hallway. As for the room‚Äôs downsides, I can mention there weren‚Äôt many hangers in the closet. Another downside was the bathroom size, which was very tiny. Everything there was basically right next to each other. But, luckily, the shower stall was big enough, and I felt comfortable showering. The bathroom amenities were of good quality and smelled nice. The Wi-Fi worked fast.The biggest downside of my stay was the price I paid - ‚Ç¨167 per night. I find this very overpriced, knowing the typical hotel prices in Lisbon, as I travel to this city every year. The nightly rate for this ibis should be about 1/3 of the rate I paid. This was the only thing that bothered me about the hotel. Meanwhile, I was generally happy with my stay, and I can totally recommend this hotel for your vacation in Lisbon or a business trip.

Very friendlystaff and clean room but disappointing that the rooms had no terrace furniture - except for top VIP floor. Also no internet access in room. Otherwise no complaints. Breakfast pretty good....

This is a very nice large hotel with free parking in a beautiful setting overlooking a river and park and within easy walking distance to the town.  Although the mid-century modern building  is somewhat old now, the facilities are all in excellent condition.  We stayed in a large double room with a good sized balcony overlooking the river.  The lobby bar has a pianist playing evenings.  The hotel has conference facilities, a health club, and a swimming pool.  The only downside was the elevators got a bit jammed up when the tour bus groups arrived.

What a find , staff all amazing , food amazing in Story restaurant, no need to go looking for restaurant‚Äôs , although the recommendations for Monte Mar accepted and another amazing place 5 mins away and a transfer there and back .

Had a fab time stay.. üëç Only 1 week, too short, def back for 2 weeks next time.. Lovely apartment, friendly staff, lovely restaurants.. Lovely warm atmosphere, near beach, great music n pubs nearby, just fab, going to recommend to friendsüëåüëåüòÅüòÅüòÅ

We had an exceptional stay in one of the Spa rooms. I really couldn't recommend this Villa highly enough. The gardens are also exceptional. Jose the host, is a delight and couldn't be more helpful. I would love to return. :)
